title: Strange behavior when using 'copy package'
description: When using the 'copy package' functionality in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui, the package 'ui' is not properly copied. Instead of being copied as 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui', it is just copied as 'ui'.
OB: As a result, the destination package 'xx' contains a package named 'ui'.
EB: The expected behavior is that the destination package 'xx' should contain a package named 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the 'copy package' functionality in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.
2. Select the package named 'xxx' as the destination package.
